edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.CramerShoupAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, CramerShoupDDHEnc, Cca1, Cca2, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, NonMalleable, SecurityLevel

    public class ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement
extends CramerShoupAbs
    Concrete class that implement Cramer-Shoup encryption scheme. By definition, this encryption scheme is CCA-secure and NonMalleable.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

        public ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement()
        Default constructor. It uses a default Dlog group and CryptographicHash.

      • ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

        public ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                              CryptographicHash hash)
                               throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog and hash. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom as source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - underlying DlogGroup to use, it has to have DDH security level
        hash - underlying hash to use, has to have CollisionResistant security level
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

      • ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

        public ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
                              CryptographicHash hash,
                              java.security.SecureRandom random)
                               throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog, hash and source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - underlying DlogGroup to use, it has to have DDH security level
        hash - underlying hash to use, has to have CollisionResistant security level
        random - source of randomness.
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

      • ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

        public ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement(java.lang.String dlogGroupName,
                              java.lang.String hashName)
                               throws FactoriesException,
                                      SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog and hash. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom as source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroupName - name of the underlying dlog group, it has to have DDH security level
        hashName - name of the underlying hash function, has to have CollisionResistant security level
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if one of the algorithm's names is not supported
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level

      • ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement

        public ScCramerShoupDDHOnGroupElement(java.lang.String dlogGroupName,
                              java.lang.String hashName,
                              java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
                               throws FactoriesException,
                                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                      SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that lets the user choose the underlying dlog, hash and source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroupName - name of the underlying dlog group, it has to have DDH security level
        hashName - name of the underlying hash function, has to have CollisionResistant security level
        randNumGenAlg - random number generation algorithm.
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group or the Hash function do not meet the required Security Level
        FactoriesException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • Method Detail

      • hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext

        public boolean hasMaxByteArrayLengthForPlaintext()
        Cramer-Shoup on GroupElement encryption scheme has a limit of the byte array length to generate a plaintext from.
        Returns:
        true.

      • getMaxLengthOfByteArrayForPlaintext

        public int getMaxLengthOfByteArrayForPlaintext()
        Returns the maximum size of the byte array that can be passed to generatePlaintext function. This is the maximum size of a byte array that can be converted to a Plaintext object suitable to this encryption scheme.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of the byte array that can be passed to generatePlaintext function.

      • generatePlaintext

        public Plaintext generatePlaintext(byte[] text)
        Generates a Plaintext suitable to CramerShoup encryption scheme from the given message.
        Parameters:
        text - byte array to convert to a Plaintext object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given message's length is greater than the maximum.

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                           java.math.BigInteger r)
        Encrypts the given plaintext using this CramerShoup encryption scheme and using the given random value.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the encryption, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when more than one value is being encrypt. Instead, we decided to have an additional encrypt value that gets the random value from the user.

        Parameters:
        r - The random value to use in the encryption.
        plaintext - message to encrypt. MUST be an instance of GroupElementPlaintext.
        Returns:
        Ciphertext the encrypted plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Plaintext is not instance of GroupElementPlaintext.

      • decrypt

        public Plaintext decrypt(AsymmetricCiphertext ciphertext)
                  throws java.security.KeyException
        Decrypts the given ciphertext using this Cramer-Shoup encryption scheme.
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - ciphertext to decrypt. MUST be an instance of CramerShoupCiphertext.
        Returns:
        Plaintext the decrypted cipher.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyException - if no private key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Ciphertext is not instance of CramerShoupCiphertext.

      • generateBytesFromPlaintext

        public byte[] generateBytesFromPlaintext(Plaintext plaintext)
        Generates a byte array from the given plaintext. This function should be used when the user does not know the specific type of the Asymmetric encryption he has, and therefore he is working on byte array.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - to generates byte array from. MUST be an instance of GroupElementPlaintext.
        Returns:
        the byte array generated from the given plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of GroupElementPlaintext.

      • generateCiphertext

        @Deprecated
public AsymmetricCiphertext generateCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Generates (reconstructs) a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.generateCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

      • reconstructCiphertext

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.reconstructCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)
